title: Aljibes 2013 Selectus Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Chippy aromas are spicy, with oak and berry support lying low. This multigrape blend is tough, bumpy and chewy in feel, while herbal minty green-leaning berry flavors end with density, chewy tannins and an echo of oak.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Amisfield 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: The black cherry, plum and cola notes of this wine are carried across the palate by ample weight and supple tannins. It lacks a bit of complexity, but offers plenty of easy charm for drinking over the next few years.

title: Anew 2015 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pale peach in color, this wine offers pleasing aromas of watermelon and strawberry. It drinks just a hair off dry, with a light spritz that perks up the interest.

title: Angel Vine 2012 Coyote Canyon Primitivo (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This Horse Heaven Hills grown wine shows aromas of tobacco, dried flowers, herbs and red and blue fruit. The palate is full bodied, with tart acidity brightening the flavors.

title: Anglim 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Deep aromas of pressed blackberries, blackcurrants and black cherries meet with leather, dried mint and crushed graphite on the nose of this bottling. Purple flowers show on the palate, where a tannic grip binds flavors of blackcurrant, elderberry and roasted meat.

title: Anglim 2013 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated blackberries mix with lush and inviting purple flowers and baking-spice notes on the nose of this appellation blend. It's juicy on the palate with minty blackberry and licorice-laced olallieberry flavors, making for easy drinking.

title: Aresti 2014 Trisquel Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Dark-fruit aromas are fairly oaky, and thus there's a hint of cinnamon to the nose. Fresh, angular and raw on the palate, this tastes of herbal plum and spice, with a touch of green olive. On the back side, olive and mint flavors accent plum and berry leftovers.

title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Mainly Pinot Noir with a touch of Gamay, this is a crisp red-currant flavored wine. It comes from northern Burgundy giving a cool character to this fruity wine. The acidity and the orange zest at the end are really refreshing.

title: Basel Cellars 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of vanilla, spice box, toast and jammy red fruit are followed by quite elegant fruit flavors. The tannins seem a bit bunched up.

title: Bedell 2012 Musée Red (North Fork of Long Island)
description: This lusciously ripened Bordeaux-style red is plush and plump in flavor yet exceedingly light on its feet. Approachable and yielding, its ruddy red cherry and berry flavors seem coated in milk chocolate. Fresh acidity and bold tannins lend structure to the finish.

title: Bodegas Fabre 2014 Phebus Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Deep, dense raisin, prune and blackberry aromas set up a chunky palate that follows the nose. Blackened, slightly bitter flavors of baked berry fruits and licorice finish with some chop and heat along with a continuation of the wine's licorice flavor.

title: Bodegas Peñafiel 2015 Baron de Filar Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Mineral aromas of sea brine, citrus and cactus are clear and fresh. This is medium in body, with good acidity and clarity across a palate that's dealing snappy citrus and white-pepper flavors. The mild-tasting finish is tangy and lively.

title: Budureasca 2015 Vine in Flames Pinot Gris (Dealu Mare)
description: Aromas of white flowers, jasmine, and lemon pith give way to pleasant acidity in the mouth. There are flavors of green apple, lemon curd and pear in the medium length finish.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pinot Gris has been making inroads in Washington of late and this producer has been leading the way. Pleasing aromas of apple and melon lead to dry full-feeling fruit flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Coffele 2015 Castel Cerino  (Soave Classico)
description: Ripe peach, apple and exotic fruit aromas lead the nose and carry over to the round, easy-drinking palate along with hints of sage and white almond. A light mineral note lends energy.

title: Columbia Winery 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: The aromas are still locked up, with notes of dark fruit and barrel spices. The palate shows restraint, considering the warm vintage and region, with refined tannins showing a deft touch.

title: Cono Sur 2015 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Crisp snap-pea and cucumber aromas are lightly citric. This feels fresh, tangy and citric, with plenty of acidic cut. Lime, pea and bell pepper flavors are about as true to Chilean SB as it gets.

title: Domaine Bègue-Mathiot 2014  Chablis
description: Run by a mother and daughter team, this estate has produced a fruity, very accessible Chablis. It has the crisp apple fruitiness of the vintage along with a fine shot of fresh citrus. The wine has a lightly mineral character, finishing with refreshing acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Produced from vines in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this is an attractively cool wine. It has lively acidity and a crisp mineral texture. With its white-fruit flavors, it is a wine with weight as well as crispness. Drink now.

title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2015 Le Château de Chaintré  (Mâcon Chaintré)
description: This wine is from the home vineyard of the Larochette family. It has produced a ripe, still young wine that is full of yellow fruits. Hints of butter and vanilla add a rich dimension to this full-bodied wine. Drink now.

title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 La Créole  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)
description: There is an attractive, smoky touch of wood in this perfumed wine. It has spice, balanced tannins with fine acidity. The wine is still young, showing the wood more strongly than it will in a year's time. Drink from late 2017.

title: Echeverria 2014 Gran Reserva Syrah (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Minty foresty aromas blend with chocolate and wild-berry scents on the nose. This feels lively but also narrow and tartaric. Flavors of plum and black fruits are oaky, while this tastes roasted and feels juicy but also choppy on the finish.

title: Loscano 2013 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: Flat slightly flabby aromas of green and grassy black fruits smell of sweet plastic and oak. This feels raw, choppy and scraping. Flavors of minty, herbal black fruits are toasty and show grainy, forced oak. Pepper and mint flavors along with scratchy tannins make for a solid but rough finish.

title: Montresor 2010 Capitel della Crosara  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: You'll find aromas of French oak, coconut, exotic spice and menthol on this brawny red. The bracing, robust palate offers raisin, prune and loads of oak-driven spice alongside assertive, grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Kate Radburnd 2014 Berry Blush Rosé (Hawke's Bay)
description: This Merlot-based rosé offers up some slightly herbal notes of thyme and bay leaf, then complements those with understated cherry—berry fruit. It's medium in weight, yet finishes with vibrant acidity. Still hanging in there, but drink up.

title: Kenefick Ranch 2015 Estate Grown Pickett Road White White (Calistoga)
description: This estate-driven white combines 75% Grenache Blanc, 25% Marsanne and 5% Viognier. Together they tease in juicy pear and apricot, supported by honeyed oak, reflecting its time barrel-fermenting. Tingling acidity shows a streak of lime and lemon on the crisp, creamy palate.

title: Jean-Max Roger 2015 Cuvée La Grange Dimière Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This is an attractive, soft Pinot Noir rosé. With its ripe red-strawberry flavors, it is rich but has plenty of crisp acidity. The balance and juicy, crisp aftertaste are deliciously refreshing.

title: Jorge Ordóñez & Co. 2015 Botani Old Vines Moscatel (Málaga)
description: Lychee and minerally aromas amount to a pleasant whole. This dry, still Moscatel is texturally round and oily, while flavors of melon, lychee and orange are a touch bitter around the edges and on the finish.

title: Joseph Filippi NV Dulce Lagrimas de Elisa Chenin Blanc (California)
description: This late-harvest style wine has a rich amber color plus concentrated aromas of honey, toasted nuts and apricot. Sweet, mouthcoating flavors are nutty, spicy and long-lasting on the finish. Fortified for extra body and alcohol, the wine is super sweet.

title: Pascal Bouchard 2015 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)
description: The wine is ripe with lime and lemon flavors. It is textured, full of fruit and with a good touch of minerality and concentration from the old vines. There is a good cut of acidity to give the wine its proper freshness. Drink from 2017.
